intro: Tecoma moritziana, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a smooth texture. Tecoma moritziana thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
